author: Hadlee Simons
title: Asus reveals Windows 10 on stick
text:
Asus reveals Windows 10 on stick   Thu, 03 Sep 2015 9:49 AM Share Your Email The Asus VivoStick. 
Intrigued by flash drive-sized PCs but the current crop of products don't cut it for you? Asus might have something interesting for you... 
The company has revealed the VivoStick at the IFA expo in Germany this week, offering Windows 10 in a tiny form factor that plugs into your HDMI port. 
As for power, you're looking at a new Intel Atom Cherry Trail processor (a step above earlier Atom-powered sticks), 2GBs of RAM and 32GBs of storage. 
Other standout features include Bluetooth 4.0, two USB ports and an audio jack. You'll need your own keyboard and mouse or make use of a smartphone app though. 
The Asus VivoStick will retail for $129. 
Asus also revealed a few more devices at IFA this week, including the ZenWatch 2 Android Wear smartwatch (with a claimed two-day battery life) and the Zenfone Zoom (packing 3x optical zoom). Read More
